description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2j647","text":"This protocol provides a method that allows the production of high titer lentivectors that preferentially transduce neurons. The lentiviral vectors produced using this protocol were used in previous studies, including re-introduction ofCD38gene expression into the hypothalamic neurons of CD38 knock-out mice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":236,"length":4}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"31C9FA79DA8911EDAABC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.creative-biogene.com/search?t=1\u0026q=CD38"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bpl04","text":"This protocol provides a method that allows the production of high titer lentivectors that preferentially transduce neurons. The lentiviral vectors produced using this protocol were used in previous studies, including re-introduction of CD38 gene expression into the hypothalamic neurons of CD38 knock-out mice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":73,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":237,"length":4}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"262BE8E0DA8911EDA032E1DA36C42FE0","url":"https://www.creative-biogene.com/support/production-of-neuron-preferential-lentiviral-vectors-protocol.html"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FDA81988DA8811EDAABC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.creative-biogene.com/search?t=1\u0026q=CD38"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7amar","text":"(1) Human embryonic kidney (HEK) 293T cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73jeo","text":"(2) Plasmids: lentiviral transfer vector","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4039m","text":"(3) Lentiviral packaging vectors: Packaging mix containing pLP1,pLP2(pRev),pLP/VSVG","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":58,"length":5},{"key":1,"offset":64,"length":4},{"key":2,"offset":75,"length":8}],"data":{}},{"key":"b56mr","text":"(4) Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium (DMEM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4hge","text":"(5) Penicillin-streptomycin-glutamine (100x)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9egqn","text":"(6) Phosphate-buffered saline (PBS)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9kmlr","text":"(7) FBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ab9th","text":"(8) Polybrene","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3o75m","text":"(9) 2.5 M CaCl2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":14,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5l24","text":"(10) 2x HEPES-buffer (280 mM NaCl, 50 mM HEPES, 1.5 mM Na2HPO4[pH7.05])","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":57,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":61,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"099231FCDA8911EDAABC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.creative-biogene.com/plp1-item-ovt2831-441648.html"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0992329ADA8911EDAABC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.creative-biogene.com/plp2-item-ovt2799-441616.html"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"09923316DA8911EDAABC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.creative-biogene.com/plp-vsvg-item-ovt2806-441623.html"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"508am","text":"(1) 10-cm cell culture dishes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ef3ot","text":"(2) 50 ml conical centrifuge tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39ksb","text":"(3) Steriflip-GP filter (0.22-Âµm) unit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9geds","text":"(4) Ultracentrifuge tubes 17.0 ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkuhu","text":"(5) Tissue culture incubator at 5% CO2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":37,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ar8r3","text":"(6) SW28.1 rotor","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dcd8","text":"(7) ultracentrifuge","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3pac","text":"(8) Fluorescent microscope","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dar0o","text":"(9) Bio safety cabinet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6v5hg","text":"(10) Centrifuge","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bmh8n","text":"Day 1: HEK cell seeding","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ul18","text":"1. Collect pre-confluent HEK 293T cells grown in DMEM supplemented with 10% FBS, 50 U/mL penicillin G and 50 Âµg/mL streptomycin (pH7.35).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fktsu","text":"2. Seed 1 Ã 106 HEK 293T cells in 10 cm dish in Step 1 and add 10 ml of DMEM supplemented with 10% FBS. Swirl the cells thoroughly to obtain even distribution across the surface of the dish. Incubate the cells for 24 h at 37Â°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctaku","text":"Day 2: Transfection","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6o53c","text":"3. Observe the dishes on Day 1. The cells should be approximately 60% confluent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"esgha","text":"4. Exchange the culture medium for fresh medium (DMEM and 10% FBS, 10 ml) and further incubate the cells for 30 min in a CO2incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":123,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48jpj","text":"5. Mix 10 Âµg of packaging mix with 10 Âµg of lentiviral transfer vector in a 1.5 ml tube. Dilute the plasmid mix with filtered ddH2O to a total volume of 450 Âµl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":129,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a77sp","text":"6. Add 50 Âµl of 2.5 M CaCl2to the plasmid mix and then add 500 Âµl of 2xHEPES-buffer while vortexing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":26,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edfl","text":"7. Add all of the transfection mixture (spreading in drops) to the plate. Swirl the plates gently and incubate under 5% CO2, 37 Â°C overnight (16 h).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":122,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fplkg","text":"Day 3: Observe the cells and change the media","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3e6cb","text":"8. Observe the cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8ce2","text":"9. Remove media, wash cells twice with 5 ml of pre-warmed PBS (-), then add 9.5 ml of fresh DMEM and 10% FBS, and further incubate under 5% CO2, 37 Â°C overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":142,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3t9df","text":"Day 4: Harvest and concentrate the viral particles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fia1m","text":"10. Collect supernatant from the dish 40 h after transfection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b01es","text":"11. Clear the supernatant of cell debris by filtering through a 0.22-Âµm filter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djbd1","text":"12. Concentrate the viral particles by ultracentrifugation. Centrifuge the supernatant at 120,000 x g for 1.5 h at 4 Â°C using a swinging bucket rotor. We use a Beckman SW28.1 rotor (the capacity is 17 ml/tube, total 6 tubes): supernatant obtained from 2 dishes (18 ml) can be concentrated with one tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9knpv","text":"13. Pour off the supernatant. The pellet will be almost invisible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjjm7","text":"14. Resuspend the viral pellet in 90 Âµl of PBS (-). The viral suspension can be used for bothin vitroandin vivoexperiments: however, if purer grade quality is needed, purify the virus through a sucrose cushion following the published protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":93,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":104,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
